readability_reflection: I think I found string concatenation more readable. It was one of the first things I learned in regards to strings, and seeing the "+" signs helped me visualize what strings were being put together.
comprehension_debugging: I think the usage of both features allowed me to quickly debug the code snippets. I was constantly flipping between the variables that represented the strings and the output of the code, which helped me piece the outputs a lot faster.
preference_rationale: I would prefer string concatenation. I am more comfortable with it and to me it is just more readable.
learning_curve: Yes I believe concatenation did make the code examples easier to understand. I was able to piece together the messages easier, given the "+" sign.
suggestions_improvement: I think both string features already work well in terms of readability and comprehension.
